title: A Fashion Designer Who Dressed Famous Singers
summary: Antony Price was a British fashion designer who made clothes for famous singers and bands. He died at 80 years old. He was known for creating cool and dramatic outfits, like pastel suits in Duran Duran's music video Rio. Price designed clothes for David Bowie, Roxy Music, and Queen Camilla. He started his own fashion label in 1979 and had his first show with model Jerry Hall. Recently, he showed his latest collection in London with singer Lily Allen. People remember him as a visionary and kind friend. He worked for over 50 years, blending menswear and womenswear to make body-hugging looks.

background_read: Antony Price was a famous fashion designer from Britain who created stylish clothes for many well-known musicians and celebrities. He helped shape the looks of rock and pop stars in the 1970s and beyond, making outfits that were tight-fitting and dramatic. His work influenced fashion shows and music videos, blending different styles to create unique designs. Learning about him shows how fashion can be an art form that connects with music and culture.
